moves.1. e4: A quick 10 move game that illustrates some of the pitfalls of eating too much material when facing the Traxler. The King in particular eats well, but dies with a full belly....
moves.4. Ng5: White advances the knight to threaten blacks pawn on f2
moves.4... Bc5: Black ignores the threat and lines up his own attack the white f2 pawn
moves.5. Nxf7: White takes the pawn on f7 and forks blacks queen and knight. Not the best move for white....but let’s see how it works out
moves.5... Bxf2+: Black hits back with a capture on f2 checking the king
moves.6. Kxf2: The hungry king takes the bishop and is now exposed to a range of potential attacks
moves.7. Ke3: And the king starts to move up the field
moves.7... Qh4: The queen joins the action and white needs to play carefully to avoid the gathering storm
moves.8. Nxh8: White presses on with the material advantage, but eight move in all is lost
moves.8... Qf2+: The king is forced to continue his march
moves.9. Kxe4: Again white claims material advantage by chewing up the knight
moves.9... d5+: The lawn checks the king, forks the bishop and frees up blacks dangerous LSB
moves.10... Bf5#: The game is over with 11 of the white pieces still unmoved.

opening: two knights defence (C57), Wilkes Barre (Traxler) variation
